title: Fixed YAML Frontmatter Issues in PDF Processing
details:
Fixed issues with YAML frontmatter in PDF processing:

1. Fixed the duplicate "---" separator issue:
   - Modified YamlHelper.UpdateFrontmatter and CreateMarkdownWithFrontmatter to ensure proper formatting with a single set of separators
   - Changed BuildYamlFrontmatter in PdfNoteProcessor to return only the YAML content without separators

2. Made sure all required fields are included in the frontmatter:
   - template-type: pdf-reference
   - auto-generated-state: writable
   - author (derived from authors field)
   - module (empty if not available)
   - lesson (empty if not available)
   - comprehension: 0
   - completion-date (empty)
   - date-review (empty)
   - onedrive-shared-link (empty if not available)
   - onedrive_fullpath_file_reference
   - publisher: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
   - pdf-size
   - pdf-uploaded

3. Ensured unwanted fields are removed:
   - aliases
   - pdf-link
   - permalink

4. Fixed how the frontmatter is passed to the AI summarizer:
   - Made sure the yaml-frontmatter variable doesn't include the "---" separators
   - Properly handled the field in GeneratePdfSummaryAsync

These changes ensure consistent YAML frontmatter in the generated markdown files with proper formatting and all required fields.
